title: WHIRLING / CEILING FAN
description: The ceiling fan is spinning like the blades of some rickety old airship about to fall on you. A truly horrendous neck-tie has somehow attached itself to one of the blades.

links.title: You: "Grab the tie."
links.text: Grab the tie.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You swoop up and catch the tie... S..."
links.text: You swoop up and catch the tie... Snap! It's released from the blade.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "What you have in your hand is a fan..."
links.text: What you have in your hand is a fantastically colourful tie, with four or five different patterns. The knot reminds you of a noose.

links.title: Logic: "If it's your *friend*, why was it u..."
links.text: If it's your *friend*, why was it up there? Who ties their friend to a ceiling fan? Maybe this thing is dangerous somehow...

links.title: Inland Empire: "An ominous, foreboding feeling fill..."
links.text: An ominous, foreboding feeling fills you, as you look at the tie.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "What you have in your hand is a tru..."
links.text: What you have in your hand is a truly hideous necktie, with four or five different patterns. The knot reminds you of a noose.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Oh no, it's happening again. You di..."
links.text: Oh no, it's happening again. You didn't catch it and now there's numbness in your left arm, plus half your chest.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "You can take this one too. Just bre..."
links.text: You can take this one too. Just breathe in slowly.

links.title: You: "Grab your arm."
links.text: Grab your arm.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "None of these is a real heart attac..."
links.text: None of these is a real heart attack. This is such a joke. You should probably just exercise more.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "This is not a *real* heart attack...."
links.text: This is not a *real* heart attack. This is a joke. It's probably just your lungs or your oesophagus. The oesophagus does practically nothing.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "It's even worse this time. Maybe yo..."
links.text: It's even worse this time. Maybe you should stop trying to catch the tie?

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "Still happening. Definitely worse t..."
links.text: Still happening. Definitely worse than the last time.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "Finally the stabbing recedes. You c..."
links.text: Finally the stabbing recedes. You could try doing it again to see how painful it gets -- but you would probably die.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "This is bad. Feels like sharp stone..."
links.text: This is bad. Feels like sharp stones grinding in your chest and keeping you from moving.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "For quite a long time."
links.text: For quite a long time.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "Still ongoing. Now is a good time t..."
links.text: Still ongoing. Now is a good time to start worrying.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "Finally the pressure recedes. You f..."
links.text: Finally the pressure recedes. You find yourself covered in cold sweat and trying not to move -- hoping it will keep you from dying.

links.title: Interfacing: "You know what you should do? You sh..."
links.text: You know what you should do? You should stop the fan and then try again, it'll get easier.

links.title: Endurance: "Do it -- *if you want to die*, the..."
links.text: Do it -- *if you want to die*, the stabbing pain in your chest is telling you. You're hanging by a thread here...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You reach out to grab the tie... bu..."
links.text: You reach out to grab the tie... but what's this? Diffuse, radiating chest pain! Doom comes over you.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "You can take it. Just breathe in sl..."
links.text: You can take it. Just breathe in slowly.

links.title: You: "Breathe in calmly."
links.text: Breathe in calmly.

links.title: You: "Grab your chest."
links.text: Grab your chest.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Oh no, it's happening again. You di..."
links.text: Oh no, it's happening again. You didn't catch it and now there's numbness in half your chest.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "You can take this. It's not nearly..."
links.text: You can take this. It's not nearly as bad as the last time.

links.title: You: "Press your hands to your chest to m..."
links.text: Press your hands to your chest to make sure your heart is still beating okay.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "This isn't a real heart attack. You..."
links.text: This isn't a real heart attack. You should probably just exercise more.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "This is not a *real* heart attack...."
links.text: This is not a *real* heart attack. This is a joke. It's probably just your lungs or your oesophagus. The oesophagus does practically nothing.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "It's worse this time. Maybe you sho..."
links.text: It's worse this time. Maybe you should stop trying to catch the tie?

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Still happening."
links.text: Still happening.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Still bad. Definitely worse than th..."
links.text: Still bad. Definitely worse than the last time.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Finally the stabbing recedes. You c..."
links.text: Finally the stabbing recedes. You could try doing it again to see how painful it gets. (Very.) But do you really want to risk it?

links.title: Pain Threshold: "This is bad. Feels like sharp stone..."
links.text: This is bad. Feels like sharp stones grinding in your chest and keeping you from moving.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "For quite a long time."
links.text: For quite a long time.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Still ongoing. Now is a good time t..."
links.text: Still ongoing. Now is a good time to start worrying.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Finally the pressure recedes. You f..."
links.text: Finally the pressure recedes. You find yourself covered in cold sweat. Try not to move too fast -- maybe that will keep you from collapsing.

links.title: You: "Breathe in and out calmly."
links.text: Breathe in and out calmly.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You reach out to grab the tie... bu..."
links.text: You reach out to grab the tie... but what's this? Radiating chest pain! Fear washes over you.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "You can take it. Just breathe."
links.text: You can take it. Just breathe.

links.title: You: "Grab your chest."
links.text: Grab your chest.

links.title: You: "Pull on the fan."
links.text: Pull on the fan.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "The switch must be broken, because..."
links.text: The switch must be broken, because nothing happens. The air in the room is starting to feel like vaporized urine.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "The blades come squeaking to a halt..."
links.text: The blades come squeaking to a halt. It should be easier to reach the tie now.

links.title: You: "Pull on the light bulb."
links.text: Pull on the light bulb.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "The lights are off again."
links.text: The lights are off again.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "The lights are on."
links.text: The lights are on.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "A terrible mistake! Turn the lights..."
links.text: A terrible mistake! Turn the lights off IMMEDIATELY! You can practically feel the photons burning a hole in your brain.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "It's just a little hangover-induced..."
links.text: It's just a little hangover-induced photosensitivity. Don't over-react.

links.title: You: "Bring it on."
links.text: Bring it on.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Little black spots dance on your re..."
links.text: Little black spots dance on your retinas. It's almost pleasurable.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Your eyes burn with photosensitivit..."
links.text: Your eyes burn with photosensitivity. It's not good.

links.title: You: "Pull again to turn the lights off."
links.text: Pull again to turn the lights off.

links.title: Ceiling Fan: "The lights are off."
links.text: The lights are off.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Ceiling Fan: "This fan has two chain pull switche..."
dialogueTree.text: This fan has two chain pull switches -- one ends in a tiny fan, the other in a light bulb. A truly horrific necktie has somehow attached itself to one of the blades.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Or has it been consigned there as p..."
links.text: Or has it been consigned there as punishment? You feel as though this creature is your *friend* and wants to reattach itself to your neck. So that you may continue your adventures together in this strange world!
